TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CoreWebView2CookieManager extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Creates, adds or updates, gets, or or view the cookies.
Docs.remarks: The changes would apply to the context of the user profile. That is, other WebViews under the same user profile could be affected.

Docs.param: The to be added or updated.
Docs.summary: Adds or updates a cookie with the given cookie data; may overwrite cookies with matching name, domain, and path if they exist.
Docs.remarks: This method will fail if the domain of the given cookie is not specified.

Docs.param: The name for the to be created. It cannot start with whitespace(s).
Docs.summary: Creates a cookie object with a specified name, value, domain, and path.
Docs.remarks: One can set other optional properties after cookie creation. This only creates a cookie object and it is not added to the cookie manager until you call . name that starts with whitespace(s) is not allowed.

Docs.summary: Deletes all cookies under the same profile.
Docs.remarks: This could affect other WebViews under the same user profile.

Public Sub DeleteCookies (name As String, uri As String)
member this.DeleteCookies : string * string -> unit

Docs.param: The name for the cookies to be deleted is required.
If uri is specified, deletes all cookies with the given name where domain and path match provided URI.
Docs.summary: Deletes cookies with matching name and uri.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteCookiesWithDomainAndPath (string name, string Domain, string Path);

Public Sub DeleteCookiesWithDomainAndPath (name As String, Domain As String, Path As String)
member this.DeleteCookiesWithDomainAndPath : string * string * string -> unit

Docs.param: The name for the cookies to be deleted is required.
If domain is specified, deletes only cookies with the exact domain.
If path is specified, deletes only cookies with the exact path.
Docs.summary: Deletes cookies with matching name and domain/path pair.

Docs.summary: Gets a list of cookies matching the specific URI.
Docs.remarks: You can modify the cookie objects by calling , and the changes will be applied to the webview.
